meta.title: Privacy Policy
meta.description: Learn how we protect and process your personal data. Read our privacy policy to better understand your rights as a user.

content.value: 1. This document is an annex to the Terms of Service. By using our services, you entrust us with your information. This Privacy Policy serves to help you understand what information and data we collect and how we use them. This data is very important to us, so please read this document carefully, as it sets out the principles and methods for processing and protecting personal data.

2. We hereby declare that we comply with the principles of personal data protection and all legal regulations provided by the Personal Data Protection Act and the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 (GDPR).

3. The data subject has the right to request comprehensive information about how their personal data is used. We always strive to clearly inform about the data we collect, how we use it, the purpose it serves, who we share it with, how we protect it when shared with third parties, and what institutions to contact in case of concerns.

4. The service uses technical measures such as physical protection of personal data, hardware infrastructure safeguards, software and database protection tools, and organizational measures to ensure the proper protection of processed personal data. These measures, in particular, protect data against unauthorized access, acquisition by unauthorized persons, unknown usage, and accidental or deliberate alteration, loss, damage, or destruction.

5. Under the rules defined in the Terms of Service and in this document, we have exclusive access to the data. Access to personal data may also be granted to entities handling payments. Such access is provided only to the extent necessary to deliver the services.

6. Personal data is processed solely for purposes to which you have given consent by selecting the appropriate fields in the form on the website or by other explicit means. The legal basis for processing your data is your consent or the necessity to perform a service (e.g., user account creation, subscription to online courses, access to educational materials), in accordance with Article 6(1)(a) and (b) of the GDPR.
1. We take privacy seriously. We are characterized by respect for privacy and the highest possible and guaranteed convenience in using our services.

2. We value the trust that Users place in us by entrusting us with their personal data for the purpose of providing electronic services. We always use personal data fairly and in a way that does not betray that trust, only to the extent necessary to provide services, including their processing.

3. The User has the right to obtain clear and complete information about how we use their personal data and for what purposes they are needed. We always clearly inform about the data we collect, how and to whom we transfer it, and provide information about entities to contact in case of doubts, questions, or comments.
4. In case of doubts regarding our use of the User's personal data, we will promptly take action to clarify such doubts and respond fully and comprehensively to all related questions.
5. We will take all reasonable actions to protect Users' data from improper and uncontrolled use and secure it comprehensively.
6. The data of the Administrator of your personal data can be found in the [link] tab located on the website.

7. The legal basis for processing your personal data is Article 6(1)(b) of the GDPR. Providing data is not mandatory but necessary to undertake appropriate actions preceding the conclusion of the contract and its execution. We will transfer your personal data to other recipients who have been entrusted with processing personal data on our behalf. Your data will be transferred based on Article 6(1)(f) of the GDPR, where the legitimate interest is the proper performance of contracts/orders. Additionally, we will share your personal data with other business partners. Collected personal data is stored within the European Economic Area ("EEA"), but it may also be transferred to and processed in a country outside this area. Each operation of transferring personal data is carried out in accordance with applicable law. If data is transferred outside the EEA, we apply standard contractual clauses and the privacy shield as safeguards concerning countries for which the European Commission has not determined an adequate level of data protection.

8. Your personal data related to the conclusion and execution of the contract will be processed for the duration of their execution, and also for a period not longer than provided by law, including the provisions of the Civil Code and the Accounting Act, i.e., no longer than 10 years from the end of the calendar year in which the last contract was executed.
9. Your personal data processed for the purpose of concluding and executing future contracts will be processed until an objection is raised.

10. You have the right to: access your personal data and receive a copy of the personal data being processed, rectify your incorrect data; request data deletion (right to be forgotten) in cases provided for in Article 17 of the GDPR; request restriction of data processing in cases indicated in Article 18 of the GDPR, object to data processing in cases indicated in Article 21 of the GDPR, transfer the provided data processed in an automated manner.

11. If you believe that personal data is being processed unlawfully, you can lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority (Personal Data Protection Office, ul. Stawki 2, Warsaw). If you need additional information related to personal data protection or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us by mail at the correspondence address.
12. We make every effort to protect against unauthorized access, unauthorized modification, disclosure, and destruction of information in our possession. In particular: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) We control the methods of collecting, storing, and processing information, including physical security measures, to protect against unauthorized access to the system.

b) We grant access to personal data only to those employees, contractors, and representatives who need to have access. Moreover, under the contract, they are obliged to maintain strict confidentiality, allow us to control and verify how they fulfill their entrusted duties, and in case of non-fulfillment of these obligations, they may face consequences.

content.value: 13. We will comply with all applicable laws and regulations regarding data protection and cooperate with data protection authorities and authorized law enforcement agencies. In the absence of data protection regulations, we will act in accordance with generally accepted data protection principles, social coexistence rules, and established customs.

14. The exact method of personal data protection is included in the personal data protection policy (DPA: security policy, personal data protection regulations, IT system management instructions). For security reasons, due to the procedures described therein, it is available only to state control authorities.

15. If you have questions regarding how we handle personal data, please contact us via the page from which the user was redirected to this Privacy Policy. The contact request will be promptly forwarded to the appropriate appointed person.
16. The User always has the right to notify us if: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) they no longer wish to receive any information or messages from us;
b) they wish to receive a copy of their personal data we hold;
c) they wish to correct, update, or delete their personal data in our records;
d) they wish to report violations, improper use, or processing of their personal data.

content.value: 17. To facilitate our response or address the provided information, please provide your first and last name and further details.

18. Our website uses cookies and other tracking technologies (e.g., LocalStorage, Facebook Pixel, Google Analytics) to improve the quality of services provided, analyze traffic, and personalize advertising content.

19. Personal data may also be processed for marketing purposes (e.g., sending information about new courses, offers, events), provided that the User has given appropriate consent. Consent can be withdrawn at any time.

20. Users can register and log in using external provider accounts (e.g., Google, Facebook). In such cases, we receive basic data from these providers (name, email address, profile picture), which are used solely to create an account and provide services.

21. As part of using the platform, we may make decisions in a partially automated manner (e.g., course recommendations), but we do not make decisions that have legal effects or significantly affect the User without human intervention.

22. To provide services, we use third-party services such as payment operators, mailing systems, cloud service providers, and analytical tools. These entities may process personal data only based on data processing agreements and in accordance with applicable law.

content.header: §3 Scope and Purpose of Personal Data Collection

content.value: 1. We process only the necessary personal data to provide services and for accounting purposes, including the following: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) for the purpose of purchasing a subscription.
b) for the purpose of concluding a contract, handling complaints, and withdrawing from a contract.
c) issuing VAT invoices or other receipts.
d) monitoring traffic on our websites.
e) collecting anonymous statistics to determine how users use our website.
f) determining the number of anonymous users of our websites.
g) controlling how often selected content is displayed to users and which content is displayed most frequently.
h) controlling how often users choose a given service or from which service most contacts originate.
i) analyzing newsletter subscriptions and contact options.
j) using a personalized recommendation system.
k) using tools for both email and subsequent phone communication.
l) integration with a social media platform.
m) potential online payments.

content.value: 2. We collect, process, and store the following user data: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) first and last name.
b) residential address.
c) email address.
d) phone number.
e) date of birth.

content.value: 3. Providing the above data is completely voluntary but necessary for the full provision of our services.
4. The purpose of collecting, processing, or using your data includes: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) direct marketing, archiving advertising campaign goals.
b) fulfilling legal obligations by collecting information on unwanted activities.

content.value: 5. We may transfer personal data to servers located outside the user's country of residence or to affiliated entities, third parties based in other countries, including EEA countries, to process personal data on our behalf.

6. We store your personal data no longer than necessary for proper service quality. Depending on the method and purpose of collection, data may be stored during the service provision and afterward for purposes such as: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) fulfilling legal obligations, including tax and accounting regulations.
b) preventing fraud or crimes.
c) statistical and archiving purposes.
d) marketing activities — for the duration of the agreement or until separate consent is withdrawn.
e) promotional and sales-related activities — e.g., contests, promotions — for the duration and settlement of such campaigns.
f) operational activities — until the expiration of obligations under the GDPR and relevant national laws.
g) pursuing any claims related to the concluded agreement.

content.value: 7. Please note that many countries to which personal data is transferred may not have the same level of legal data protection as the user's home country.

1. We automatically collect information contained in cookies to gather user data. A cookie is a small piece of text sent to the user's browser and returned by the browser on subsequent visits to the website. They are mainly used to maintain sessions, e.g., by generating and returning a temporary identifier after login. We use 'session' cookies stored on the user's end device until they log out, close the website, or close the web browser, and 'persistent' cookies stored on the user's end device for a time specified in the cookies' parameters or until they are deleted by the user.

2. Cookies tailor and optimize the site and its offerings to users' needs through activities such as generating view statistics and ensuring security. Cookies are also necessary to maintain the session after leaving the website.
3. The administrator processes the data contained in cookies each time the site is visited for the following purposes: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) optimizing website usage,
b) identifying logged-in users,
c) customizing graphics, selection options, and other site content to the user's individual preferences,
d) remembering data filled in manually or automatically from Order Forms or login credentials provided by the visitor,
e) collecting and analyzing anonymous statistics about website usage in the admin panel and Google Analytics,
f) creating remarketing lists based on preferences, behavior, usage, interests, and demographic data, then sharing those lists in AdWords and Facebook Ads,
g) creating data segments based on demographic information, interests, and preferences in choosing viewed products/services,
h) using demographic and interest data in Analytics reports.

content.value: 4. The administrator uses cookies for analytical and statistical purposes to understand how users use our website, as well as for marketing purposes.
5. Users can disable or delete cookies at any time using their web browser settings.

1. We have the right, and in some cases the legal obligation, to provide selected or all personal data to public authorities or third parties that request such information under applicable Polish law.

2. The user has the right to access the personal data they provide. The user may correct, supplement, or request deletion of their data at any time, or request the cessation of data processing without giving any reason. To exercise their rights, the user may send a relevant message via email or any other form that conveys such a request.
3. The processing of personal data of individuals who are our customers is based on: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) legitimate interest as a data controller (e.g., database creation, analytical and profiling activities, product usage analysis, direct marketing, documentation for legal defense or claims)
b) consent (especially for email marketing or telemarketing)
c) performance of a contract
d) legal obligations (e.g., tax or accounting regulations)

content.value: 4. The processing of personal data of individuals who are potential clients is based on: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) legitimate interest of the data controller (e.g., database creation, direct marketing)
b) consent (especially for email marketing or telemarketing)

content.value: 5. A user request to delete or stop processing personal data may result in the inability to provide services or significantly limit their availability.
6. We attach special importance to profiling and state that: [subsections]

subsections.value: a) profiling is based on data previously encrypted via SSL
b) typical data used includes email address, IP, or cookies
c) profiling is used to analyze or predict personal preferences and interests to customize content in our services or products
d) profiling is used for marketing purposes to tailor marketing offers to preferences

content.value: 7. We are committed to complying with applicable laws and social coexistence principles.
8. Information on out-of-court resolution of consumer disputes: The authorized entity is the Financial Ombudsman, whose website is: www.rf.gov.pl.

1. Every user should take care of the security of their own data and the security of the devices they use to access the Internet. Such a device must have antivirus software with a regularly updated virus definition database, a secure version of the web browser being used, and an enabled firewall. The user should check whether the operating system and installed programs have the latest and compatible updates, as attacks often exploit vulnerabilities found in outdated software.

2. Access data for Internet services — e.g., logins, passwords, PINs, digital certificates, etc. — should be secured in a location inaccessible to others and protected against unauthorized access via the Internet. This data should not be disclosed or stored on a device in a way that allows unauthorized access or reading by unauthorized persons.
3. Be cautious when opening suspicious attachments or links in email messages, especially those that were not expected or come from unknown senders or from the spam folder.

4. It is recommended to enable anti-phishing filters in the web browser — tools that check whether the displayed website is genuine and not intended to steal information, e.g., by impersonating a person or institution.

5. Files should be downloaded only from trusted places, services, and websites. Installing software from unverified sources, especially from unknown publishers with unverified reputations, is not recommended. This also applies to portable devices such as smartphones and tablets.

6. When using a home wireless Wi-Fi network, a strong and secure password should be set — one that is difficult to guess and not based on predictable patterns such as street names, host names, or birth dates. It is also recommended to use the highest possible wireless encryption standards available on the device, e.g., WPA2.
